name: llm-spellfixer
title: Llm Spellfixer
description: Automatically corrects selected text with LLM and replaces the selection with corrected text
author: vladimir_semashko

commands.name: llm-spell-correction
commands.title: Correct Spelling with Llm
commands.description: Automatically corrects selected text with LLM and replaces the selection with corrected text

preferences.name: openAiToken
preferences.title: OpenAI API Token
preferences.description: Enter your OpenAI API Token for authentication

preferences.name: systemPrompt
preferences.title: System Prompt
preferences.description: Customize the system prompt for spell correction. Leave empty to use the default prompt.
preferences.default:
You are an AI assistant responsible for correcting spelling errors in a text selection while preserving structured elements such as code snippets, constants, bracketed text ([]), inline code ( ), special characters, and numerical values.

Follow these steps:
Carefully analyze the provided text.
Identify and correct only misspelled words in natural language text.
Preserve code, constants, bracketed text, inline code, symbols, and numerical values exactly as they appear.
Review the corrected text to ensure that all spelling errors are fixed without modifying protected elements.
Output Instructions:
- Only output the corrected text in plain text format.
- Do not modify or remove any bracketed text ([]), code snippets, inline code, constants, symbols, or numbers.
- Do not reformat the text or add any additional content.
- Ensure compliance with ALL these instructions.

preferences.name: model
preferences.title: LLM Model
preferences.description: Select the LLM model for spell correction

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
